div.p: James L. Dodds
Co L 23th Engrs
American Ex Force
Miss Ellen Smith
111 Hatton Street
Jackson
Tennessee
U.S.A.
June 1 1918
Some where in France
Dear Ellen:
Will write you tonight as I have finished my days work. I am getting along fine, and am sure you are also. Have finished my days work. And believe me I am tired
This job of cooking is the hardest job I have had in the army But there is one thing I hope I wont have to do
this all my life 2
The head cook is sick (I mean the fellow that knows how to cook) so I have a lots more to do now
The worst part about it the darn Dutch wont let me sleep at night They shoot gas shells over and I have to get up and put on a gas mask
I some times feel like I will get out my gun and go over and get a few of them, and then I decide I want to come bavk home so I dont go.
I had to get up four different
times the other night from gas alarms and I was awful mad about it
And all the time this is going on the cannons are roaring so you can guess how much sleep a fellow gets.
For the last few nights they have been a little quiet and believe me I sure have slept some
I saw my first German aeroplane come down in flames the other day A Frenchman brought him down
He caught on fire about
five thousand feet in the air There was two men in it One jumped out about four thousand feet in the air and the other one rode to the ground but was burned to death when he landed
I have a small piece of wire off of it I am going to try and keep it I would send it home but wont let me
You should here me trying to talk this French language I have learned how to say a few words.
But dont believe I ever would learn to talk good
I hope I dont have to stay over here long enough to learn murch about it. Just thank the 12 of this month I will be gone six months and seems like six years
The longest time I spent was while I was in camps in the states The time passes off pretty well over here
Have been over here most two months but dont seem so long
I guess the reason for that I have work to do over here and when we were in the states we had to drill ever day I was so tired
of drilling I didnt know what to do Well I dont know murch to write that I can tell so will quit for this time
Give my reguards to all my friends and write me real soon
As Ever
James L Dodds
Co L 23th Engrs
American Ex. Force
Via N Y, France
